column4: i have a doubt! The Synaptic packages can only be use to update / install softwares by the net or there is a way to install download .deb or .rpm packages using it?
i have a doubt! The Synaptic packages can only be use to update / install softwares by the net or there is a way to install download .deb or .rpm packages using it?
please dont repeat questions more often than about every 5 mins
the answer is ''yes'' :-)
sorry man, but i am very excitated with my fresh version of ubuntu lol
and the question is how??
people here dont like Ubuntu questions, there is #ubuntu...
the best way would be to set up a local APT repository area, and add that to the '/etc/apt/sources.list'
i didnt understand what you d mean with "peoplew here dont like ubuntu questions"
but thanks you for the tip
there is a separate channel for Ubuntu related questions.
wait a sec for a link anyhow.
well sorry for the question, but the channel topic is "Have a question? Just ask"
lol, now i am undesrtaning :D
this will tell you all about APT :-) http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/apt-howto/
my last question: Is there a list of cool web repositories to APT, or whatever can i call it?
yes, and they are dangerous, but: http://WWW.apt-get.org/
not so dangerous as I am behind vmware ;)
also, use 'aptitude' in preference to 'synaptic' if you want to do dangerous things
and look at my sample configu files here: http://WWW.sabi.co.UK/Cfg/APT/
well man, thanks a lot for hte help ;)
